text: Classified into early 24-48hrs and late >48hrs Airways: Upper = obstruction, oedema, stridor Lower = smoke inhalation, wheezing, respiratory distress, pulmonary oedema Later = Scarring of face (limited movement and mouth opening), tracheal stenosis. Pulmonary: Early = Hypoxia, CO poisoning Later = Circumferential chest wall restriction, infection, restrictive lung disease (fibrosis) Circulation: Early: Hypovolaemia, decreased CO, increased SVR, ischaemic reperfusion injury Late: Increased CO, hypertension, tachycardia Neurology: Confusion, cerebral oedema, raised ICP Burns encephalopathy = confusion, seizures, delirium, hallucinations, coma (causes: hypoxia, sepsis, cortical vein thrombosis, low Na)
